content: Folksonomies Moz News By: Rand Fishkin January 18, 2005 The author's views are entirely their own (excluding the unlikely event of hypnosis) and may not always reflect the views of Moz. Table of Contents Copied! By: Rand Fishkin January 18, 2005 Folksonomies Moz News The author's views are entirely their own (excluding the unlikely event of hypnosis) and may not always reflect the views of Moz. An impressive new idea from the world of librarians, cataloguers and other reference technicians called Folksonomies has taken root in the world of web search. This new technology exploits users' time to classify and meta-label the web through browsing. The promise of this new categorization sytem would be the documentation of the web by each website's and web page's visitors. An exceptional paper on the subject, Folksonomies - Cooperative Classification and Communication Through Shared Metadata, by Adam Mathes explains the concepts behind the technology and the sites that currently use them - Del.icio.us and Flickr. So, surprisingly, a folksonomy is not when Bob Dylan gets a vasectomy... but, it's a good guess. Copied! Back to Top
